meanings.definition: To make, sell, or transport (alcohol) illegally.
meanings.sent2: The criminals bootlegged alcohol across state lines.
meanings.sent3: The bootlegged alcohol made the party more exciting.
meanings.sent4: She bootlegged the alcohol like a modern-day pirate.
meanings.sent5: The image of bootlegged alcohol being smuggled in the dead of night stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: An illegal copy or version of something, especially a recording.
meanings.sent1: He sold bootlegged DVDs on the street corner.
meanings.sent2: The concert was ruined by bootlegged recordings being sold outside.
meanings.sent3: The bootlegged movie had terrible sound quality.
meanings.sent4: The bootlegged album was a cheap imitation of the original.
meanings.sent5: The market was flooded with bootlegged copies of the popular game.
